required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Psychological Impact of COVID-19 Pandemic in Healthcare Workers
clinical_study.official_title: Psychological Impact of COVID-19 Pandemic in Healthcare Workers in Spain: A Cross-sectional Study. PSIMCOV Group

brief_summary.textblock:
Background. The current coronavirus disease (COVID-19) has a great impact worldwide. Healthcare workers play an essential role and are one of the most exposed groups.Information about the psychosocial impact on healthcare workers is limited.
Methods. 3109 healthcare workers completed a national, internet-based, cross-sectional 45-item survey between 9 and 19 April 2020. The objective is to assess the psychological impact of the COVID-19 pandemic in Spanish healthcare workers. A Psychological Stress and Adaptation at work Score (PSAS) was defined combining four modified versions of validated psychological assessment tests (A) Healthcare Stressful Test, (B) Coping Strategies Inventory,(C) Font-Roja Questionnaire and (D) Trait Meta-Mood Scale.

detailed_description.textblock: PSAS (Psychological Stress and Adaptation at work Score) is a self conducted questionnaire designed to assess psychological impact in healthcare workers to match times of crisis and when the time is scarce. PSAS has a range between 0 and 105, and higher scores represent higher stress detected.

primary_outcome.measure: PSAS (Psychological Stress and Adaptation at work Score) during the crisis
primary_outcome.description: evaluate the severity of psychological impact of the pandemic in Spain in healthcare workers

secondary_outcome.measure: PSAS (Psychological Stress and Adaptation at work Score) in basal conditions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After the pandemic (back to regular activity to be considered in the future as we do not know it yet. It expected to be in less than one year.
secondary_outcome.description: evaluate the psychological stress in Spain in healthcare workers

intervention.intervention_name: Psychological stress and adaptation at work score (PSAS)
intervention.description: completing a survey based on PSAS

study_pop.textblock:
Respondents are healthcare workers in any center/hospital treating patients and are involved directly or indirectily with patients who suffer from COVID-19.
Respondents might be physicians, nurses, ancillary staff, etc or be involved in other type of jobs like administration, techinical support, kitchen and cleaning servicies, etc.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Active healthcare workers in any private/public hospital > 18 years old
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal to participate

responsible_party.investigator_full_name: Carolina Soledad Romero Garcia, MD, PhD

patient_data.ipd_description: The investigators did not ask to the ethical committee board for data sharing approval
